alert.note: Alert for Arenac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 9:04PM EDT until April 09 at 2:50AM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Rifle River near Sterling affecting Arenac County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Rifle River near Sterling. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, High water begins to impact canoe livery at River View Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EDT Friday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EDT Friday was 6.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 3.1 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.0 feet on 04/26/1957. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Rifle River Sterling 6.0 6.0 Fri 8 pm EDT 5.1 4.4 4.0 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM EDT.
